meanings.definition: A person who is clumsy or awkward in movement or style.
meanings.sent1: The typp tripped over their own feet while walking.
meanings.sent2: She always felt like a typp on the dance floor, bumping into others.
meanings.sent3: The typp tried to juggle but ended up tossing the balls everywhere.
meanings.sent4: He was a typp in the art of coordination, like a puppet with tangled strings.
meanings.sent5: The typp's movements were as graceful as a newborn foal learning to walk.

meanings.definition: To make a mistake or error.
meanings.sent1: I typped when I accidentally deleted the important file.
meanings.sent2: She typped by forgetting to set the alarm for the morning.
meanings.sent3: He typped by pouring salt instead of sugar into the cake batter.
meanings.sent4: The student typped by answering the wrong question on the test.
meanings.sent5: They typped by sending the email to the wrong recipient.

meanings.sent1: He only had a typp of sugar left in the jar.
meanings.sent2: She added just a typp of pepper to the soup for flavor.
meanings.sent3: The typp of water in the cup was barely enough to wet his lips.
meanings.sent4: A typp of kindness can go a long way in brightening someone's day.
meanings.sent5: The typp of sand in his shoe felt like a mountain as he walked.
